title: Le Pen calls electoral ban 'political decision,' vows to fight to run in 2027 presidential election
summary: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen was on Monday found guilty of embezzlement and banned from running in elections for five years, effective immediately. She said the court decision was designed to prevent her from 'being elected in the presidential election' but that she would look for ways to have it overturned.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid in jeopardy after court bans far-right leader from running in elections
summary: Convicted of embezzlement of public funds, the French far-right leader was on Monday sentenced to a five-year ban on running for office, effective immediately, even pending an appeal.

title: With Le Pen barred from running for president, is her lieutenant, Jordan Bardella, up to the challenge?
summary: Marine Le Pen was banned from running for office effective immediately, and is not certain that her appeal trial will take place before the 2027 presidential election. Her lieutenant faces questions over his idle leadership.

title: Marine Le Pen convicted: World and domestic reactions to ban on running for office
summary: The Kremlin and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban were among the first to react to the far-right leader Marine Le Pen's sentence for embezzlement of public funds.

title: At least 322 children reportedly killed in Gaza in 10 days, UNICEF says
summary: On Monday, UNICEF said that more than 15,000 children have reportedly been killed after nearly 18 months of war. Ending a nearly two-month ceasefire in the war with Hamas, Israel resumed intense bombing of Gaza on March 18 and then launched a new ground offensive.
